description: From Latin periplūs (“account of a voyage”) and Ancient Greek περίπλους (períplous, “voyage, naval manouver, account of a voyage”), from περί (perí, “peri-: around”) + πλοῦς (ploûs, “voyage”), from πλεῖν (pleîn, “to swim”). Cf. French périple, Spanish periplo, & Italian periplo.

nouns.description: periplus (plural peripluses or peripli or periploi)

entries.meaning: (literature) An account of a voyage, particularly those of Hanno and Arrian, recording ports and coastal landmarks. [1613]
(uncommon) Synonym of circuit: the path or distance around a coast. [1776]
(uncommon) Synonym of circumnavigation: a voyage around an island or the world. [1854]
